meanings.definition: A large body of water, usually the sea
meanings.sent1: The ship sailed across the vast meer under the bright sun.
meanings.sent2: The children played happily by the calm meer on a warm day.
meanings.sent3: The fisherman caught a shoe in the meer, thinking it was a big fish!
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled like the shimmering meer under the moonlight.
meanings.sent5: The stormy waves crashed against the rocky shore of the wild meer.

meanings.definition: To be nothing more than; only
meanings.sent1: I can meer imagine how exciting the party will be!
meanings.sent2: She wanted to meer relax and enjoy her day off.
meanings.sent3: He could meer dream of becoming a superhero for Halloween.
meanings.sent4: The old book could meer be used as a doorstop.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the students to meer focus on their studies.

meanings.sent1: The fence marked the meer between the two properties.
meanings.sent2: The sign indicated the meer of the national park.
meanings.sent3: The cake was the meer of her self-control; she couldn't resist a second slice!
meanings.sent4: The mountain range acted as a natural meer for the country.
meanings.sent5: The finish line was the meer of their long and challenging race.
